```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(terra)
library(tidyterra)
library(cowplot)
theme_set(theme_cowplot())
```

```{r}
alaska = vect("GIS/AK state boundary/Shape/GU_StateOrTerritory.shp")

ggplot() +
  geom_spatvector(data = alaska) +
  theme_minimal()
```

I'll trim down the Alaska boundary using the crop() function in terra:

```{r}
# determine the extent of the spatial vector
as.vector(ext(alaska))
```

```{r}
# crop the spatial vector
alaska = crop(alaska, c(-179.23109, -100, 
                        51.175096, 71.43979))
```

```{r}
ggplot() +
  geom_spatvector(data = alaska) +
  theme_minimal()
```
